key_facts: Certain fungi are evolving to survive at human body temperature.
Some fungi are developing resistance to antifungal drugs.
Chinese researchers identified two rare fungal infections from new species.
The fungi tolerated 37°C and mutated faster at higher temperatures.
The study links fungal adaptation to rising global temperatures.
Experts debate the direct role of climate change in fungal evolution.
Drug-resistant fungi like Candida auris pose a growing global health risk.
There are limited antifungal treatments currently available.
Fungi's similarity to humans makes drug development difficult.
Understanding fungal threats can aid future outbreak prevention.
